quest.name: The Silence of the Gods
journal: Thanks to you, Vajra and her people need no longer live in fear.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We had to use force to secure the crystals. Alisaie...was not gentle.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You've finished, then. Good. I'm glad it's over.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I hate leaving it all to you. It makes me wish there were some way of borrowing the Echo.

dialogue.name: VAJRA
dialogue.text: You have done us a great ssservice this day. Long shall my sssisters sssing the praises of the eikon-ssslayer.

dialogue.name: VAJRA
dialogue.text: Let usss bear word to them of Sri Lakshmi's passsing. Come, friends─to Vira Nilya!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Had the Qalyana's beliefs been closer to those of the Vira, this crisis could surely have been avoided...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: If only I had your power. The things I would do...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I just hope we won't have to deal with any more primals before we march on Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: VAJRA
dialogue.text: 'Twas your victory. 'Tis only meet that you be the one to tell my sssister.

dialogue.name: SARISHA
dialogue.text: Ahh... The winds whissspered of your successs...and your eyes confirm their tessstimony. The Lady of Blisss no longer holds our Qalyana sssisters in Her thrall. For thisss we thank you.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Forename did the deed. We were but witnesses to herhis heroism.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: However, I fear this is only the beginning, for there is no cure for that which drives the desperate to beseech the gods for salvation. Should they wish to use their crystals to summon Sri Lakshmi again, naught can be done to stop them.

dialogue.name: SARISHA
dialogue.text: We ignore our sssisters' plight at our peril. Thisss we know. We shall endeavor to show them another path ssso that the day you ssspeak of never comes.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: We're all in this together─Ala Mhigans and Ananta. We understand that. Hopefully, in time, they will too.

dialogue.name: SARISHA
dialogue.text: You and yours will ever be friends of the Vira. On that you have my word.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: We should be getting back to the Peering Stones. Thank you again, Sarisha. For everything.

dialogue.name: SARISHA
dialogue.text: All Vira will know of your deeds. Long shall they be celebrated.

dialogue.name: VAJRA
dialogue.text: It was an honor to ssserve you, eikon-ssslayer.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: We heard about the primal. Excellent work. If you are looking for Arenvald and his unit, they are currently investigating reports of suspicious activity in the area.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: The hero returns, together with herhis stalwart comrades-in-arms. Glad to hear you managed to deal with the Ananta's primal before it could cause us any more grief. Gods know we have enough to worry about.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Welcome back! Conrad and Marshal Tarupin came to render aid─but I hear that won't be necessary...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: It won't. Sri Lakshmi's gone. Ah, but I should probably start at the beginning...

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Incredible. I don't know what to say... If you hadn't been there to stop her, who knows where it would've ended.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: You've saved a lot of lives, Forename. Take pride in that.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: It must be said that this is something of an unprecedented situation. Previous summonings were, to my knowledge, planned well in advance by a tribe as a whole.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Indeed. There are several aspects of this incident which bear further investigation. In any event, the Qalyana's supply of crystals must remain limited for the foreseeable future, and ambient aether levels closely observed.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: Understood. The Alliance will consult with the Resistance and the Vira on how best to enforce said restrictions.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text:
Thank you, Vice Marshal.
To other matters, then. What news of the imperials?

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: None─which itself is troubling. It seems as though the Skulls and the remainder of the garrison have fully withdrawn into the Peaks. We've seen neither hide nor hair of them since Velodyna.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: Regardless of their reasons, our path is clear. Father has decided that it is time to advance east.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Finally!

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: ...He was also most emphatic that you be spared further duties for the present. You are to rest. It would not do for the Warrior of Light to collapse from exhaustion during the march.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: We may not be as strong or as quick as herhim, but we are soldiers nonetheless. We can deal with the imperials.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: Aye. You've earned this respite, so enjoy it. And the same goes for you, M'naago. You've been away from your family too long─don't deny it.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: ...As you say, sir. Thank you. We'll make the most of our time here.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Much will hinge on whether we can capture or destroy Specula Imperatoris. Though the facility was unassailable from the north, it is very much vulnerable to attack from the south.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I know how you feel. I've never taken kindly to people telling me to rest.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Naago used to tell me stories about her home, but somehow it didn't really register that we'd be up this high...

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Heh heh, looks like it's up to me and mine to give you lot a proper welcome.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: My mother prepared a special meal for this occasion, and I have it on good authority that hers is the finest cooking this side of the Velodyna!

dialogue.name: MRAHZNUN
dialogue.text: Honored guests, I pray you partake of our humble offerings as we give thanks for your many valiant deeds.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Thank you, sir, for this warm welcome. We are honored to break bread with you and your family.

dialogue.name: MHAHTOA
dialogue.text: Come, come, eat your fill of our food, and drink deep of our spirits. There is more than enough for all.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Well, when you put it that way─don't mind if I do!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: She wasn't kidding when she said her mother could cook.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: You know, seeing her with her family...I can't help thinking of my own.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: How my father would come home from a hunt with dinner on his shoulder, and Yda would prepare it with herbs and spices... Our mother died when I was little, so she did most of the cooking...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: We didn't have much, but we had each other. And that was enough for me.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: But they wouldn't let us have even that. Theodoric, Gaius... Of course Father and Yda had to fight. I would have too, if I'd been older. But they didn't have to die...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: It never ends, does it? They call us beasts...and they treat us like them. They push and they push and they...until someone pushes back. Until someone takes up arms or...or summons a god. A false god.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: If the Twelve are watching us, what are they thinking?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: What are they thinking when they see the strong hurt the weak? When people fight and die, and nothing gets better, and it just goes on and on and on...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: There is no justice. Just us.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You'd have to ask Them.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: ...I know. That's why we're here, isn't it?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: ...I don't think the gods listen to people like me.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Thanks for listening. I know I was just rambling...but I feel better somehow.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Who knows what the answers are─or if there even are any. Either way, life goes on, and we've got to...go with it. Sorry, that sounded better in my head. I must be getting tired. Time to turn in, I think.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Tomorrow's another day, eh? Let's see what it brings. Sleep well, Forename.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Because I've got other skills! In case you've forgotten, I'm one of the finest hunters this tribe has ever seen! And anyway, I don't remember you being a master culinarian!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...How long has it been since I last saw my father? Maybe Alphinaud and I should plan a trip to Sharlayan. When all of this is over, I mean.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: So if your mother's food is so good, why are you such a terrible cook? Honestly, you've got to get her to teach you the basics while we're here.

dialogue.name: MRAHZNUN
dialogue.text: Leaving so soon? Then may you walk with the Warden ever at your side.

dialogue.name: MHAHTOA
dialogue.text: Keep an eye on my daughter, would you? And yourself while you're at it.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: There is something to be said for a home-cooked meal, is there not?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We must cherish these moments, fleeting as they are. The fight will always be there, waiting for us to return...

obj.n: Make a Man Out of You
